result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie Vashawn Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jamie Vashawn Robinson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jamie Vashawn Robinson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING JANUARY 16, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including supervision fees, DNA & DV surcharges due during probation period. To  be paid from bail.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No contact order; and due to DV conviction under Federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
**Provide DNA sample.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.
No contact with victim unless approved by Court or agent.
No contact with firearms.

Batterers Intevention program.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamie Vashawn Robinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jamie Vashawn Robinson in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC Agent also in Court.  Defendant has some violations involving alcohol.   Defendant refused to admit to alcohol use.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 3  DAYS of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Jamie Vashawn Robinson in court.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance, court order 10 DAYS of condition Time, but stayed time and allowed agent to impose 10 DAYS if there are any further violations by bring order before the court.. Defendant advised he must maintain absolute sobriety. Case adjourned for further review.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 09/19/14. AR

Defendant Jamie Vashawn Robinson in court with attorney Joseph T. Domask.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS,  credit for 5 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR & 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS & 6 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 100 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim, unless approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, DNA & DV surcharges due during probation period, to be paid from bail, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. 
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Letter on behalf of defendant.

Defendant Jamie Vashawn Robinson in court with attorney Joseph T. Domask.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing. Parties ready to proceed. Case is adjourned due to court scheduling conflict. Case set for Sentencing in branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamie Vashawn Robinson in court with attorney Joseph T Domask.  Matthew Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing. Branch 23 in trial, no spin courts available. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamie Vashawn Robinson in court with attorney Joseph T Domask.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE RECALLED. Parties have reacehd a resolution of this matter.
AS TO COUNT 2  
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jamie Vashawn Robinson in court with attorney Joseph T Domask.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is set for Jury Trial. 1st call.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defense ready to proceed. State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution. Defense motion to Dismiss is GRANTED by the Court without prejudice.
AS TO COUNT 2
Parties ready to proceed, case passed to allow parties to further discuss possible resolution.

Defendant Jamie Vashawn Robinson in court with attorney Joseph T. Domask.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 5/19/2014.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 04-04-2014 at 08:30 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 05-19-2014 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Jamie Vashawn Robinson in court with attorney Joseph T. Domask.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Original Information, received and filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

Defendant has a pending case in Branch 23.  Motion for joinder, with no objection from defense counsel, granted by the Court.
Defense counsel requests case be adjourned for trial.  Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 23.  Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set.

03/1/14 vf

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sasha D or Bessie D

Defendant Jamie Vashawn Robinson in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Jamie Vashawn Robinson in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
